events.message: The customer reported a vehicle accident involving a collision with another car at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to the description of the car collision.
An agent was assigned to handle the investigation of the vehicle accident claim.
The customer received confirmation that their auto accident claim has been acknowledged and the process started.
The claims department requested accident report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and police statements from the customer.
The customer promptly submitted all requested documents including police reports and vehicle damage photos.
The investigation team began assessing the collision details and evaluating the extent of damage to the vehicle.
Investigation concluded with a full assessment of liability and damage valuation for the auto accident claim.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer covering vehicle repairs and other related expenses.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the settlement offer and outlined their acceptance in a response.
The claim was formally approved after the customer's acceptance of the proposed settlement amount.
Payment for the approved claim was processed and issued to the customer's account for vehicle repair costs.
The auto accident claim was officially closed following payment issuance and confirmation from the customer.
All claim documents and records related to the vehicle collision were archived for future reference.
